3ed8c401-bb28-40bf-a0eb-7b2dae14614e.description: Individuals who earn the CxA Certification have demonstrated the technical, management, and communication skills required for competent performance, as well as their independence. They are industry professionals who lead, plan, coordinate and manage commissioning teams to implement commissioning activities, coordinate operator training activities, complete warranty phase activities, conduct existing building commissioning, and conduct on-going commissioning.

alignments.name: ANSI National Accreditation Board (ANAB) accreditation
alignments.description: The CxA Certification has been ANAB accredited since 2017. The ANSI National Accreditation Board (ANAB) accreditation mark is a symbol of excellence, recognized worldwide by employers, industry leaders, hiring managers, and credential holders.

alignments.name: Better Buildings - U.S. Department of Energy guidelines
alignments.description: Since 2017 the CxA certification has been recognized by the U. S. Department of Energy's Better Buildings initiative. DOE recognizes certification programs that are aligned with the Better Building Workforce Guidelines and which have received accreditation by qualified accreditation bodies who are in compliance with ISO/IEC 17024:2012.

badge_template_activities.title: ACG will verify that the applicant’s current employer is an independent commissioning company. An independent commissioning company is one that provides independent commissioning services and does not also provide services that present conflicts of interest. The CxA certificate is the sole property of ACG and must returned upon request.

To be eligible for certification as a CxA, candidates must meet all requirements as well as qualify for one of 4 "tracks" based on their highest level of education or licensure. Select the link for more information.
Earner must have participated in a minimum of three commissioning projects. The projects may not include one or two family residential buildings.
As a condition of earning and maintaining certification, applicants for CxA certification must agree to uphold and abide by the CxA Code of Ethics.

Submittal of a signed copy of the Certified Commissioning Authority (CxA) application form, including all provisions, agreements and attestations, is required for participation in the CxA certification program.

Earners must pass the 4-hour CxA exam. The exam consists of 120 questions designed to test a candidate's ability to understand and apply commissioning concepts, and analyze the types of issues CxAs typically face on the job. The exam is based on the occupational guidelines for Building Commissioning Professionals that was developed by the U.S. Department of Energy.
